contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Five ships of the [[United States Navy]] have borne the name '''USS ''Hercules''''', after [[Hercules]], the Roman name version of [[Heracles]]. [[Hercules]] also is the name of constellation. *{{USS|Hercules|1869}}, was a monitor ironclad steamer, originally named ''Quinsigamond'', she was rechristened ''Hercules'' from 15 June to 10 August 1869, and then to ''Oregon'' *{{USS|Hercules|YT-13}}, was a tugboat, purchased by the US Navy in April 1889 for use in the Spanish-American War. She was sold in 1937 *{{USS|Hercules|YE-30}}, was a lighter purchased by the US Navy in 1918. She was sold in 1923 *{{USS|Hercules|AK-41}}, was acquired by the US Navy in 1941 and transferred to the Maritime Commission in July 1946 *{{USS|Hercules|PHM-2}}, was an {{sclass|Pegasus|hydrofoil}} commissioned in 1982 and sold in 1996 {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hercules}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
